data.enText: a new plan for dealing with a particular problem or for achieving a particular purpose
a government initiative to combat unemployment
data.chText: 政府应付失业问题的新方案

data.enText: the ability to decide and act on your own without waiting for sb to tell you what to do
You won't get much help. You'll have to use your initiative .
data.chText: 你不会得到多少帮助的。你得自己想办法。

data.enText: She did it on her own initiative (= without anyone telling her to do it) .
the power or opportunity to act and gain an advantage before other people do
data.chText: 掌握有利条件的能力（或机会）；主动权

data.enText: It was up to the US to take the initiative in repairing relations.
data.chText: 在修复关系方面应由美国采取主动。

data.enText: (in some states of the US) a process by which ordinary people can suggest a new law by signing a petition
data.chText: （美国某些州的）公民立法提案程序

simple_means.memory_skill: initiat(e) 入会 + -ive 形容词后缀

means: （美国某些州的）公民立法提案程序
掌握有利条件的能力(或机会)

tr: the first of a series of actions
readiness to embark on bold new ventures

example: the initiative phase in the negotiations
an initiatory step toward a treaty
his first (or maiden) speech in Congress

example.ex: Government initiatives to help young people have been inadequate...
example.tran: 政府在积极帮助年轻人方面做得还不够。

example.ex: There's talk of a new peace initiative.
example.tran: 传闻有可能提出新的和平倡议。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N to-inf

value.def: An initiative is an important act or statement that is intended to solve a problem.

example.ex: We have the initiative; we intend to keep it...
example.tran: 我们拥有主动权;我们不打算放弃它。

example.ex: He paused enough to consider the options but never so long as to lose the initiative.
example.tran: 他停顿了一会儿权衡自己有哪些选项,但并没有久到丧失主动权。

value.def: In a fight or contest, if you have the initiative, you are in a better position than your opponents to decide what to do next.

example.ex: She was disappointed by his lack of initiative.
example.tran: 她对他缺少进取心感到失望。

example.ex: ...workers who are able to sort out problems on their own initiative.
example.tran: 能主动解决问题的工人

value.def: If you have initiative, you have the ability to decide what to do next and to do it, without needing other people to tell you what to do.

example.ex: We must take the initiative in the struggle to end the war...
example.tran: 为尽早结束战争,我们必须抢先行动。

example.ex: She knew she had to take the initiative and maintain an aggressive game throughout.
example.tran: 她知道自己必须采取主动，并且始终保持咄咄逼人的态势。

value.def: If you take the initiative in a situation, you are the first person to act, and are therefore able to control the situation.
value.tran: 采取主动;首先采取行动

trans: 达摩计划；达摩组织；达摩首创
主动性；积极主动；采取主动
太阳计划；升夏倡议；新能源计划
精通先攻；优先改善；强化先攻
能源计划；研究小组；能源研究计划；能源倡议

partsOfSpeech.d: 短时间内集中紧张进行的

posit 放 + -ive 形容词后缀
